decisions.reason: align with Tier0 model-signal canonical naming
rg_safety: Replace quoted dict keys only: ["key"] / .get("key") / {"key": ...}.
Prefer file-scoped replacement (one module at a time).

decisions.reason: generic key with multiple semantics across modules; global replacement is unsafe

replacements.notes: edges.confidence is a compatibility alias (often == nli_confidence for evidence edges); remove the generic key and expose only the canonical NLI/Bayes fields
internal decomposition confidence; does not map to llm/nli/bayes without further design
timeline_json internal field; normalizing requires explicit JSON-column migration plan
NLI output uses generic key; normalize to producer/object specific key to avoid mixing with other confidences

rg_safety: Never do global replace of "confidence".
If renaming, only replace quoted dict keys in a single file at a time.

decisions.reason: generic status key across tasks/jobs/domains; not a single canonical mapping

replacements.when: MCP get_status response and task lifecycle
replacements.notes: aligns with DB tasks.status and MCP schema; full-field renaming requires coordinated migration
provider response contract; renaming to llm_response_status is possible but intentionally postponed

rg_safety: Never global-replace "status".
If a future full-field normalization renames it, do it per object (task_status/job_status/llm_response_status...).

decisions.reason: generic enum key; multiple unrelated meanings (claim_type, task type, JSON Schema keyword, etc.)

replacements.when: MCP JSON Schemas / sanitizer / server tool definitions
replacements.notes: JSON Schema keyword 'type' is external spec; never rename
ties to config/prompts/decompose.j2 output contract; rename prompt output key and parser together
part of MCP meta contract; only rename under full-field normalization

rg_safety: Never global-replace "type".
Do not touch JSON Schema 'type' fields.
